overview: "A journey divided into five segments, moving from chaos to harmony [...] Through the free and lucid eye of his Super 8 camera, Courant's shutter opens and initiates the Eighties with the first part of his tetralogy "Le Jardin des Abymes". Featuring music that ranges from Steve Reich to Vivaldi, from Philip Glass to Santana, the soundtrack, as was highlighted by Lysianne Léchot, creates its own trip: a passage from "the repetition of synthetic music to the harmony of classical." -Diego Trerotola
title: Aditya
